item.title: TrueNAS 25.10 Begins Testing With Faster Performance, 400GbE Networking
item.description: The folks at iXsystems announced this afternoon that nightly builds of TrueNAS 25.10 are now available for testing of this Linux-based network attached storage (NAS) operating system. With TrueNAS 25.10 there are more performance improvements, improved installation process, initial support for 400GbE networking, and other enhancements to this ZFS-focused platform...

item.title: Bitcoin Mining Not Causing Any Energy Issues, Says Paraguay Power Provider
item.description:
Bitcoin mining operators are putting less of a strain on Paraguay’s power grid than engineers initially predicted, the nation’s power provider says.

The post Bitcoin Mining Not Causing Any Energy Issues, Says Paraguay Power Provider appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.description:
Crypto price prediction today reports on Bitcoin’s new ATH, surging altcoins, and recent U.S. policy moves shaping the $2.3T crypto market. Analysis covers XRP, Sei, OKB, and presale project Bitcoin Hyper amid speculation of an ongoing post-halving bull run.

item.title: Solana Price Prediction: SOL Leads Altcoin Rally as Crypto Market Hits $4T – Is $1,000 Solana Already Confirmed?
item.description:
Solana price prediction has shifted upward after SOL exceeded $200, supported by 28% gains over 30 days, $13B trading volume, and altcoin season momentum. Analysts see a possible pullback to $190 before a rally toward $500.

item.title: Stablecoins Set to Capture $1 Trillion Payment Volume by 2028, Could Reshape US Monetary Policy: Report
item.description:
Keyrock–Bitso research has projected a trillion in stablecoins volume by 2030, with stablecoins set to handle 12% of cross-border flows and possibly 10% of U.S. money supply. Onchain settlement has cut costs and time, while issuers’ T-bill holdings have affected yields and market structure.

 

The post Stablecoins Set to Capture $1 Trillion Payment Volume by 2028, Could Reshape US Monetary Policy: Report appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: PayPal and BlackRock Moves Ignite Arbitrum ($ARB) – Will $0.59 Finally Fall?
item.description:
Arbitrum ($ARB) has built momentum through upgrades and partnerships: PYUSD support on-chain, Timeboost has been designed to speed processing, a $14M audit subsidy has been approved, and Offchain Labs has acquired ZeroDev. Price has tested $0.56–$0.57, with $0.59 watched and $0.48–$0.50 support.

The post PayPal and BlackRock Moves Ignite Arbitrum ($ARB) – Will $0.59 Finally Fall? appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: US Treasury Doubles Down, Hits Crypto Exchange Garantex with Second Sanction
item.description:
US Treasury’s OFAC has redesignated Garantex and sanctioned successor Grinex, executives, and affiliates, citing more than $100 million in illicit crypto transactions since 2019 and prior 2022 actions.

The post US Treasury Doubles Down, Hits Crypto Exchange Garantex with Second Sanction appeared first on Cryptonews.
